intro: Nautilocalyx hastatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved nautilocalyx, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, typical of many members of the Rubiaceae family. Nautilocalyx hastatus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments.
